did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: This collection consists of one item.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Engraving of the Rotunda and Lawn, 1837, Accession # 9188-a, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to the library by Julien Green on August 28, 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a framed engraving of the Rotunda and Lawn, by Arnout, engraved by Traversier, Paris, 1837. This plate was published in Roux de Rochelle, Etats-Unis d'Amerique(Paris, 1837) as a part of a work entitled L'Univers: Histoire et description de tous les peuples(Paris, 1835-63). It is recorded in William O'Neal's iconography of the 19th-century prints of the University of Virginia, The American Association of Architectural Bibliographers Papers, Vol. 6 (No. IIIe, pp. 89- 9). On the back is mounted Julien Green's holograph inscription to the University, 'donné à l'Université de Virginie par Julien Green 1973'.
Click here to view an image of the engraving.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following items were removed from the collection and cataloged as rare books:

Discours pour la réception de M. Julien Green(Paris: Institut de France, 1972) PQ2625.A93 Z663 1972
Discours de réception de M. Julien Green à l'Academie francaise. Réponse de Pierre Gaxotte.([Paris]: Plon, 1972 [i.e. 1973]) PQ2625.A93 Z663 1973
Works by Anne Green: Mes jours évanouis, La lanterne magique, Le vestiaire des anges, L'or et l'argent, La Bonne aventure, La porte des songes, Corinne et le prince persan
